articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Company Servicepersons (Urgent)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Company Servicepersons (Urgent)

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed an art performance given by servicepersons of companies under KPA Units 762, 966, 630, 337 and 233 who proved successful at the 35th servicepersons' art festival of the KPA.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Company Servicepersons of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance Given by Company Servicepersons of KPA

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed an art performance given by servicepersons of companies under KPA Units 762, 966, 630, 337 and 233 who proved successful at the 35th servicepersons' art festival of the KPA.
					
					They put on the stage colorful numbers of diverse genres including poem recital "Recollecting General's Jeep", narration and chorus "Let Us Sing of Fatherly Love," harmonica solo "The Kitchen Wagon Runs," sketch "Birthplace of Soldier", willow flute ensemble "Country Will Always Remember Them," poem and story-telling "At Old Battlefield", dialogic poem "General and Our Snow Flower Company", one-man show "Decorum and Morals of Soldier", instrumental quintet "I Am Girl Soldier in Songun Era", story-telling and song "Our Army and Our People" and chorus "Arms of Mt. Paektu Will Reply".
					
					The performance fully demonstrated the determination of the servicepersons of the People's Army to keep to the road of devotedly protecting the leader and safeguard the socialist country as human bullets and bombs.
					
					He expressed great satisfaction over the splendid performance staged by the company servicepersons as it is replete with the revolutionary soldier spirit. He extended special thanks of the KPA Supreme Commander to them.
					
					He sent them the highest appreciation, saying it was the performance strong and clear in the ideological stand as it answered the question as to what is the true nature of the KPA, the presentation which one wishes to watch everyday and the most successful one.
					
					He told commanding officers to highly commend those performers so that their parents in their native places might be proud of them.
					
					Noting that this performance was the best of those given by the company servicepersons so far, he extended thanks to the officials who sincerely helped the servicepersons in their mass cultural activities and told the commanding officers to properly commend them. 
					
					He said the performance given this time once again proved that the real worth of art lays not in high artistry but in the influence it exercises on masses and how it arouses their thoughts.
					
					He noted that the servicepersons of the People's Army have grown to be stalwart soldiers who are strong in ideology and faith as they are fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique and acquired high cultural attainments, adding that the socialist country is invulnerable as it is guarded by the army strong in ideology.
					
					He had a photo session with the above-said company servicepersons. 
					
					Among the audience were senior officials of the Party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk and Ri Myong Su, KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong, Ri Pyong Chol, Yun Jong Rin and Hyon Chol Hae, officials of the WPK Central Committee, servicepersons of the People's Army and officials in the fields of literature and art and media.

articles.title: President of DPRK SPA Presidium Leaves to Visit Tanzania
articles.content:
President of DPRK SPA Presidium Leaves to Visit Tanzania

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left here on Tuesday to pay an official goodwill visit to the United Republic of Tanzania.
					
					His entourage includes Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun.

articles.title: Congratulations to Spanish PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Spanish PM

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a congratulatory message to Mariano Rajoy Brey upon his election as prime minister of Spain.
					
					The message wished him success in his responsible work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Returns Home
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Returns Home

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of its Central Committee, returned home on Tuesday after visiting Malaysia to attend the Congress of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Chollima Steel Complex
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Chollima Steel Complex

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the work at the Chollima Steel Complex on Tuesday.
					
					He acquainted himself with the production of Juche iron of the Posan Iron Works and looked round various shops before holding a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					The meeting discussed technical issues to keep iron and steel production going at a steady rate and supply necessary raw and other materials in time in the high-pitched drive of South Hamgyong Province.
					
					On the same day he went round production processes and potato storehouses of the updated Raknang Potato Processing Factory to take measures for reenergizing the production.

articles.title: Doctorate Awarded to Intellectual of Merit in DPRK
articles.content:
Doctorate Awarded to Intellectual of Merit in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A doctorate of the DPRK was conferred on Pak Yun Sam, a teacher of University of Science who made great contributions to solving the problem of household fuel in an effective way.
					
					A ceremony of awarding the doctorate took place at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.

articles.title: Pyongyang Folklore Park under Construction
articles.content:
Pyongyang Folklore Park under Construction

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The construction of the Pyongyang Folklore Park is progressing apace in Korea.
					
					Frame assembling and interior projects have almost been finished in the park construction.
					
					The park, which is being built in a large area at the foot of Mt. Taesong, will showcase the history of the nation and miniatures of historic relics, structures built in recent decades, folk village, folk amusements and Mts. Paektu and Kumgang.
					
					Visual aids showing the 5 000-year-long Korean history will be installed in the quarter of history at the entrance of the park.
					
					More than 130 full or reduced-sized historic relics, including the mausoleums of King Tangun and King Tongmyong and the monument to the great victory in the battle in northern area of Korea, are taking shape in the quarter of historical interest.
					
					The present era quarter will include miniatures of the Tower of the Juche Idea, Party Founding Memorial Tower, West Sea Barrage, Arch of Triumph, Chollima Statue and other monuments and edifices.
					
					The folk village quarter is full of models of palaces, government offices and dwelling houses dating back  to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), Koryo Kingdom (early 10th century-late 14th century), Palhae Kingdom (698-926) and Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					Restaurants serving cuisines peculiar to different localities are also being built there.
					
					The visitors will be able to enjoy views of Mts. Paektu and Kumgang and folklore amusements like archery, ssirum (Korean wrestling), seesawing, swinging and yut-game in the park.

articles.title: Mun Yong Nyo, Celebrated Aerialist
articles.content:
Mun Yong Nyo, Celebrated Aerialist

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Mun Yong Nyo, a 46-year-old aerialist of Pyongyang Circus, is very popular for her amazing stunt performance.
					
					Mun was the first in the world to perform a treble somersault and a double somersault with rotation in a 360 degree arc.  
					
					An aerial stunt "Conquerors" performed by DPRK aerialists won a gold lion prize at the 13th Wuqiao International Acrobatic Festival held in China some days ago. It was the top prize of the festival. In the stunt she performed a treble flip-flap in the air. 
					
					After graduating from Pyongyang Acrobatic School in 1982, she has been active as an aerialist for nearly 30 years.
					
					She also played a leading role in "Three-stage Trapeze Flight", the predecessor of "Conquerors."
					
					"Three-stage Trapeze Flight" won top prizes at the Cuba International Acrobatic Festival in 1987, the 16th Monte Carlo International Acrobatic Festival in 1992 and the 5th Wuqiao International Acrobatic Festival in 1995.

articles.title: Traditions of Juche Are Eternal Treasure of Socialist Korea--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Traditions of Juche Are Eternal Treasure of Socialist Korea--Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary traditions of Juche are a lifeline of Kim Il Sung's nation and eternal wealth of Songun Korea.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article dedicated to the 20th anniversary of publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Brilliantly Carry Forward and Develop the Revolutionary Traditions of Juche".
					
					The glorious revolutionary traditions of the Workers' Party of Korea have originated from the anti-Japanese struggle organized and led by President Kim Il Sung. They fully embody the idea, theory and ways to be maintained as guidelines in the whole course of carrying out the socialist cause and comprehensively deal with the wealth of experience gained in the struggle and valuable exploits, says the article, adding:
					
					These traditions serve as an ideological and moral treasure that enables to eternally glorify the history of the Korean revolution as the history of Kim Il Sung and an eternal cornerstone that makes it possible to develop the revolutionary ranks into the most powerful ones of single-minded unity. They also serve as a lifeline that ensures the constant creation of heroic epics of great innovations and leap forward in the indomitable revolutionary spirit. 
					
					The Juche traditions, associated with the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his idea and exploits, serve as the most precious boon of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Il Sung's Korea. 
					
					The tradition of the single-minded unity created by the President spurs the advance of the Korean revolution and helps bolster the might of Songun Korea. It is the true picture of the DPRK at present in which the leader, army and the people share the common idea, will and destiny in the world of comradeship.
					
					Despite the changed environment and situation of the revolutionary struggle and replacement of generations, the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu serves as the driving force that hardens the mental power of the Korean people and makes the DPRK demonstrate its dignity as an invincible power.
					
					The inexhaustible might of this spirit has been brought into full play in the drive for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Reunification through Alliance with North Desired by S. Koreans
articles.content:
Reunification through Alliance with North Desired by S. Koreans

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Reunification through alliance with the north is an irresistible desire of the south Koreans and the trend of nation's history toward justice and patriotism.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					South Koreans from all walks of life, awakened to the value of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration amid the anti-reunification storm, have grown in their aspiration after the reunification through alliance with north, the article says, and goes on:
					
					An atmosphere of supporting and defending Songun politics is mounting among all the south Koreans.
					
					More than 400 articles lauding the Songun politics have been posted on Internet homepages a day despite the oppression by the fascist authorities. This shows the hot wind of supporting Songun politics sweeping south Korea.
					
					South Koreans are unanimous in asserting that "unification of systems" is impossible even though the authorities pour huge taxes collected from people in escalating confrontation with compatriots but reunification by federal formula is possible if the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are implemented.
					
					South Korean people greatly yearn for socialist system centered on the popular masses in the north.
					
					It is quite natural that people, living in the hell-like society where the dignity and rights of the working people are trampled down, long for the man-centered socialist system and turn out in the movement for reunification through alliance with north for a new politics and life.

articles.title: Japan's Claim to Tok Islets under Fire: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan's Claim to Tok Islets under Fire: Minju Joson

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Japanese ambassador in Seoul recently said the projected construction of facilities on Tok Islets "can never be accepted from Japan's stand", expressing "regret" over it. 
					
					His shameless claim to the islets shows that he is obsessed with the ambition for grabbing other's territory, Minju Joson Tuesday says in a bylined commentary. 
					
					The DPRK does not feel any need to argue with Japan over whom the set of disputed Islets belong to, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					Tok Islets had never been Japan's and they have existed as part of an inviolable territory of Korea generation after generation throughout the 5 000 year-long history of the Korean nation.
					
					Japan has often claimed the islets without any ground. Herein lies its sinister intention which can never go unnoticed. 
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are eager to dominate the whole of Asia, not just the group of small islets. 
					
					Japan has long made big efforts to become a military giant and launch military expansion overseas. 
					
					The reality proves that the Japanese reactionaries' ambition for militarist expansion overseas aimed at aggression has been pushed forward in real earnest. 
					
					It is a foolish daydream for Japan to give its eye-teeth for Tok Islets. Japan would be well advised to stop coveting for them.

articles.title: Protest against FTA Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Protest against FTA Unabated in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- More than 3 000 south Koreans held a meeting opposing the FTA with the U.S. outside the Posin Pavilion in Seoul on Dec. 3, according to the south Korean KBS. They included members of the Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the Conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement, opposition party assemblymen and citizens.
					
					The participants slammed the GNP's railroading of the motion calling for ratification of the agreement, declaring it null and void.
					
					At least 1 000 workers under the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally calling for the nullification of the motion at the plaza of Seoul Railway Station on the same day.
					
					They marched to Kwanghwamun Square, denouncing the authorities for their sycophantic act of humiliation.

articles.title: Plane Crash Kills Two Pilots in S. Korea
articles.content:
Plane Crash Kills Two Pilots in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Two pilots were killed by a crash of a plane of the south Korean puppet Air Force's 16th combat air division amid a military drill in Kaepho-myon, Ryechon County of North Kyongsang Province, according to MBC of south Korea.

articles.title: International Meeting Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
International Meeting Supports Korean People's Just Cause

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The 3rd international meeting against imperialism was held in Dhaka, Bangladesh from Nov. 27 to 29.
					
					Attending it were delegates of political parties and organizations and personages of all social standings from nearly 30 countries including the DPRK as well as citizens.
					
					The Dhaka declaration and a special resolution on the DPRK were adopted there.
					
					The declaration denounced the U.S. for scheming to stifle socialist Korea, and strongly demanded it withdraw the hostile policy toward the DPRK it has persistently pursued for over half a century. It also expressed support for the Korean people's cause of national reunification.
					
					Voicing hope for the Korean people's reunification cause, the resolution said:
					
					The United States should withdraw its hostile policy toward the DPRK and renounce the annual military exercises for aggression in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					For the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, the U.S. should withdraw its armed forces for aggression from south Korea and accept the DPRK's proposal for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace agreement.
					
					We fully support the Korean people in their efforts to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Prospering Economy of DPRK: Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
Prospering Economy of DPRK: Brazilian Organization

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on Nov. 24 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "Prospering economy of DPRK".
					
					The United States and south Korea are spreading a false rumor slandering the national economy of the DPRK, the article said, and went on: 
					
					In recent years the DPRK has worked unprecedented miracles and innovations in socialist economic construction.
					
					Many countries are paying growing attention to the DPRK, a country with huge economic potentials and rich natural sources. Their geopolitical view of the DPRK is changing day by day.
					
					It is a foolish act to slander the DPRK defying this reality.
					
					By spreading the distorted opinion they seek to lay obstacles in the way of turning the DPRK into an economic power.
					
					As far as the economic stagnation and bankruptcy are concerned, the U.S. is troubled by a large number of poor people and south Korea by an increasing number of those who commit suicides due to unemployment and poverty.
					
					The DPRK will further strengthen the might of the self-supporting economy.

articles.title: S. Korea Should Not Misjudge DPRK's Will: Bangladeshi Organization
articles.content:
S. Korea Should Not Misjudge DPRK's Will: Bangladeshi Organization

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy issued a statement on Nov. 29 in support of the report of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army.
					
					A touch-and-go situation has been created in the Korean Peninsula due to the large-scale anti-DPRK war exercises staged by the south Korean military warmongers, the statement said, and went on:
					
					The south Korean authorities seek to escalate confrontation and ignite an all-out war against the DPRK through the war maneuvers.
					
					Their reckless moves for confrontation have touched off protest and denunciation of the world progressive people who love peace.
					
					The south Korean puppet military warmongers should neither forget the lesson from the Yonphyong Island incident a year ago nor misjudge the will of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK which are fully ready for a decisive battle against any military provocations.
					
					We denounce their war maneuvers against the DPRK as a renewed political and military provocation against it and strongly demand the south Korean authorities stop them.

articles.title: China to Prevent Land Erosion in Yangtze River Basin
articles.content:
China to Prevent Land Erosion in Yangtze River Basin

					Beijing, December 5 (KCNA) -- China is directing efforts to the prevention of land erosion in the basin of the Yangtze River. 
					
					The government has a view to keeping land in the area of 78 500 square meters from being washed away during the 12th Five-Year Plan. 
					
					In this period such steps will be reportedly taken as forestation and river improvement projects in the basin.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Interfering in Nicaragua's Internal Affairs
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Interfering in Nicaragua's Internal Affairs

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A Nicaraguan congressman Thursday accused the United States of interfering in Nicaragua's domestic affairs after U.S. Congresswoman Ileana Ros-Lehtinen said there had been fraud at the Nov. 6 general elections.
					
					Agustin Jarquin, president of the Nicaraguan Christian Democratic Union party and an ally of the country's ruling party, said the remarks of Ros-Lehtinen were a clear "interference" in Nicaragua's political affairs.
					
					"The Nicaraguan people decide on that issue," Jarquin said. "The Nicaraguan people clearly elected their president and their congress members beyond the deficiencies of the electoral process."

articles.title: U.S. Unemployment Rate
articles.content:
U.S. Unemployment Rate

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Jobless people are increasing in number in the United States due to the financial crisis.
					
					Total unemployed Americans were 13.3 million in November, according to survey data of the U.S. Labor Department on Dec. 2.

articles.title: Pakistan Calls for End to Israeli Occupation of Arab Territories
articles.content:
Pakistan Calls for End to Israeli Occupation of Arab Territories

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Pakistan called for putting an end to Israeli occupation of the Arab territories.
					
					The statement came as Pakistani UN Ambassador Abdullah Hussain Haroon was addressing the General Assembly in a plenary meeting on the question of Palestine.
					
					Haroon said it is imperative to address its root cause, i.e., the Israeli occupation of the Arab territories.
					
					The Pakistani government actively supports the founding of an independent Palestinian state, he said, calling upon the international community to work on freezing all Israeli settlement activity and achieving comprehensive peace in the Middle East.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Hails Creation of New American Bloc
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Hails Creation of New American Bloc

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez on Friday hailed the creation of a new American bloc that groups 33 Latin American and Caribbean states, calling it a major milestone for the region's development and sovereign policy.
					
					Chavez made the remarks as he addressed the opening session of a summit of the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC).
					
					He said that Latin America is "a land of giants" with huge untapped potential for business and development.
					
					He also said that the people in Latin America have fought for years for a deeper integration.

articles.title: Nigeria Vows to Fight Corruption
articles.content:
Nigeria Vows to Fight Corruption

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian government has reiterated its determination to fight corruption to ensure the success of its transformation agenda and restore the good image of the country.
					
					Vice President Namadi Sambo made the reaffirmation on Thursday at a ceremony in honor of the recipients of the Nigerian National Merit Award for 2010 and 2011.
					
					Sambo described corruption in Nigeria as a "cancer," which had thwarted the government efforts to improve the quality of people's life.

articles.title: Sudan Criticizes ICC Prosecutor's Request for Arrest Warrant against Defense Minister
articles.content:
Sudan Criticizes ICC Prosecutor's Request for Arrest Warrant against Defense Minister

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Sudanese government on Friday criticized a request by chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) Luis Moreno-Ocampo for issuing an arrest warrant against Sudanese Defense Minister Abdel-Rahim Mohamed Hussein.
					
					"The Sudanese government regards the arrest warrant request as politically targeting the Doha Document for Darfur Peace which tackled all the region's issues including the issue of justice and reconciliation," said the Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement.

articles.title: Namibia Supports Founding of Independent Palestinian State
articles.content:
Namibia Supports Founding of Independent Palestinian State

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Namibia said on Wednesday that the core of the Arab-Israeli conflict lays within finding a "lasting and comprehensive solution" to an independent State of Palestine.
					
					Jerobeam Shaanika, deputy Namibian permanent representative to the UN, made the statement as he was addressing the UN General Assembly in a plenary meeting on the question of Palestine.
					
					"Namibia shares the conviction that achieving a just, lasting and comprehensive settlement of the question of Palestine, the core of the Arab-Israeli conflict, is imperative for the attainment of peace and stability in the Middle East," said Shaanika.
					
					He voiced Namibia's support for the "restart" of the stalled Middle East peace process, which came to a halt due to the ongoing Israeli settlement activities in the occupied Palestinian territory.

articles.title: Africa Should No Longer See New Generation with HIV Infection: AU Commission Chief
articles.content:
Africa Should No Longer See New Generation with HIV Infection: AU Commission Chief

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Marking the World AIDS Day on Thursday, Jean Ping, chairman of the African Union Commission, said Africa should no longer see new generations with HIV infection.
					
					Through his representative, Ping called for individual and collective action to contain mother to child transmission of HIV.
					
					"We should act individually and collectively not only to prevent mother to child transmission but also to take care of the health of people living with the virus," said the chairman.
					
					He also expressed commitment of the AU Commission to work with member states and pertinent bodies in the efforts made to HIV treatment and prevention.

articles.title: Eurozone Producer Price Index Up
articles.content:
Eurozone Producer Price Index Up

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The industrial producer prices index rose by 0.1 percent in eurozone nations in October compared with September, said Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union (EU), on Friday.
					
					The indices for eurozone 17 nations and 27-member EU rose 5.5 percent and 6.4 percent on an annual base in October.

articles.title: Irish Consumer Confidence Down in November
articles.content:
Irish Consumer Confidence Down in November

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Irish consumer confidence dropped slightly in November, according to figures released on Friday.
					
					The figures, released in the latest KBC Bank Ireland/ESRI consumer sentiment index, showed that the index fell to 60.1 in November from the 16 month high of 63.7 in the previous month.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- China and Botswana agreed to expand exchange relations in the fields of education, science and culture on Dec. 1.
					
					Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia signed a memorandum of understanding on cooperation program in order to cement more than ever the bonds of partnership, solidarity and cooperation on Nov. 30.

articles.title: Cambodia's Total Trades Worth 9.44 Bln USD in 10 Months
articles.content:
Cambodia's Total Trades Worth 9.44 Bln USD in 10 Months

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Cambodia's import and export trades reached 9.44 billion U.S. dollars in the first ten months of this year, up 42 percent from 6.66 billion U.S. dollars in the same period a year ago, the statistics of the Commerce Ministry of this country showed Friday.

articles.title: Exports Increase in Iran
articles.content:
Exports Increase in Iran

					Tehran, December 5 (KCNA) -- Iran's amount of exporting goods in various fields except the oil industry grew up 8.5 percent in the first eight months of the present Iran's year, as compared with the same period of the last year, according to a recent report by a newspaper of this country.

articles.title: Excessive Cesium Levels Detected in Rice from More Farms in Fukushima, Japan
articles.content:
Excessive Cesium Levels Detected in Rice from More Farms in Fukushima, Japan

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Excessive levels of radioactive cesium have been detected in rice harvested at more farms in Fukushima city, the Fukushima prefectural government said Friday.
					
					In the latest finding, levels surpassing the provisional upper limit of 500 becquerels per kilogram set by the central government were detected in rice from paddies run by five farming households, with the highest level at 760 becquerels, the prefectural government said.

articles.title: Quake Shakes Chiba Prefecture, Japan
articles.content:
Quake Shakes Chiba Prefecture, Japan

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A magnitude 5.2 earthquake jolted Japan's Chiba Prefecture Saturday.
					
					The epicenter was waters off the southeast area of the prefecture.

articles.title: Canada's Unemployment Rate Up Again in November
articles.content:
Canada's Unemployment Rate Up Again in November

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- After losing 54 000 jobs in October, Canada's economy continued to shed 18 600 positions in November, pushing unemployment rate up 0.1 percentage point to 7.4 percent, Statistics Canada said on Friday.

articles.title: GNP Termed Arch Criminal of Cyber Terrorism
articles.content:
GNP Termed Arch Criminal of Cyber Terrorism

					Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The group of the Grand National Party of south Korea was disclosed to have mounted Ddos attack on Internet website of the Central Election Management Commission on October 26, the election day.
					
					Fact emerged that the secretary of Choe Ku Sik, assemblyman from GNP, requested a man specializing in homepage to commit a Ddos attack on the website of the commission a day before the election. That man was confirmed to have hailed from the same village as Choe.
					
					The GNP calculated that less voters would be more favorable for it. This, however, sparked serious chaos.
					
					Homepage of Pak Won Sun, independent candidate who ran against the candidate from GNP, came under Ddos attack, too, which was also blamed on the GNP.
					
					This brings into bolder relief that the GNP-led puppet group is the mastermind of hacking cases called "cyber terror" sweeping south Korea.
					
					The group is trying to evade its responsibility.
					
					It is clear to everyone that the mere secretary can never give instructions to mount such an attack.
					
					Involved in the cyber attack were several accomplices who moved under his instructions, over 200 computers and great efforts and equipment, an indication of a huge amount of money that was required for executing the case.
					
					All facts prove that the conservative ruling quarters are the arch criminal of the shocking cyber terror in south Korea.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang Kim Yong Nam hacia Tanzania
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang Kim Yong Nam hacia Tanzania

					Pyongyang, 6 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, partio el dia 6 de esta capital para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Unida de Tanzania.
					
					Le acompanan el canciller Pak Ui Chun y otros acompanantes.

articles.title: Japon sigue sufriendo por contaminacion radiactiva
articles.content:
Japon sigue sufriendo por contaminacion radiactiva

					Pyongyang, 6 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Japon sigue sufriendo por la contaminacion radiactiva causada por el accidente de la planta nuclear de Fukushima.
					
					Las autoridades del departamento de Fukushima aclararon el dia 2 que fueron registrados al maximo 760Bq por cada kilogramo de granos cosechados en varias granjas de dicha ciudad.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia proceder grosero de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia proceder grosero de Japon

					Pyongyang, 6 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el embajador japones acreditado en el Sur de Corea dijo que la construccion de algunos establecimientos en el islote Tok es "una cosa lamentable y nunca aceptable en la posicion de Japon". 
					
					Revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue: 
					
					La insistencia cinica del diplomatico japones muestra que el esta enloquecido por la ambicion de usurpar el islote coreano Tok. 
					
					No tenemos la necesidad de discutir con Japon sobre el derecho a la posesion del islote Tok. 
					
					Este islote vino considerandose como una parte del territorio propio de Corea junto con la historia de cinco milenios de la nacion coreana.
					
					El pais isleno persigue la malsana intencion de apoderarse no solo del islote Tok sino tambien de todo el continente asiatico. 
					
					Desde hace mucho tiempo, Japon vino haciendo desesperados esfuerzos por convertirse en la potencia militar y dirigirse a la expansion militarista a ultramar. 
					
					La realidad demuestra que tal expansion a ultramar se impulsa perseverantemente en etapa crucial. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben abandonar la ilusion vana de usurpar el islote Tok.
